tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: What are the principal service projects?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Teaching conversational English is the service project in southern Italy. In the spring and fall, volunteers are needed to teach conversational English to elementary, middle school, or high school students under the direction of Italian English teachers in Manduria, Monopoli, Brindisi and communities surrounding Ostuni. You will assist in each day's classroom work using student texts and established lesson plans provided by the teacher. You'll also have opportunities to depart from the formal lessons. For example, you can serve as a resource on topics of North American culture, including discussions on history, daily lifestyle, sports, and school systems. Some volunteers also teach American songs and games, while others provide instruction on continuing dialogues and writing letters.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: In the summer, volunteers are also needed to teach conversational English in Ostuni, but you will conduct your lessons much more independently. These are intensive English language programs for children eight to 14 years old. Instead of teaching hand in hand with a local teacher, you and your teammates will work under the guidance of a single local coordinator who will want you to oversee your own lessons.

html body text table tbody tr td div div p font b span
content: How can you be sure you are really making a difference?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font span
content: English has become the international language of commerce and technology. Children and adults all over the world want to learn English as a tool for their future development. That is why the teachers and school administrators in the Pulgia region of Italy invited Global Volunteers to send volunteers to teach conversational English in 1995. The Italian English teachers are very good English grammarians and they are excellent teachers. However, English is their second, third or perhaps fourth language. Students want and need to learn pronunciation, idioms and syntax from native English speakers. With that said, it is apparent that sharing English conversation with a native speaker for only one or two weeks will not greatly enhance a student's ability to speak English. However, working with several native English speakers for many weeks each year - year after year - can have a tremendous positive effect. We know this is the case because the teachers keep inviting us back and enthusiastic students keep showing up for class, month after month, year after year. You can truly make an enormous difference in the lives of Italian students by teaching conversational English, even for just a week or two!

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div p font b span
content: What types of people volunteer in Italy?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font span
content: People from all walks of life and from countries all over the globe volunteer in Italy. However, the vast majority are from the U.S. 67% are women and 33% men. Most are college graduates. 10% are under 30 and 80% are 50 or older.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font a span

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font span
content: Most teams include between 8 and 15 volunteers plus the team leader.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Please schedule your arrival at the airport in Brindisi, Italy (airport code BDS).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: When should I arrive in Brindisi?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font span
content: Please book your arrival at Brindisi airport no later than 6:30 PM on the service program arrival date. If you cannot arrive by 6:30 PM, you can either arrive a day or two early and stay at your own cost in Brindisi or the community where you will be serving, or arrive later that evening and make your own way to the hotel. However, if you arrive later, you may miss the initial orientation session scheduled for the first evening.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div p font span
content: You can also take the train from Rome. If you plan to arrive by train, you can go to Brindisi and meet the rest of the team at the airport. Or, if you are scheduled to go Ostuni, you can go straight to the Incanto Hotel without stopping in Brindisi. All trains coming from the north will stop in Ostuni before going on to Brindisi. You should get off the train in Ostuni (the station is on the outskirts of town) and take a taxi to the hotel. The cost of a taxi is approximately USD8 - 10.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: Will someone meet me at the airport?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: If you send your flight itinerary to Global Volunteers at least two weeks in advance of the service program arrival date, your team leader will meet you up at the designated airport during two periods of the day. The first pick up will correspond with the early afternoon flight from Rome, which arrives at approximately 2:00pm. The second pick up will correspond with the early evening flight from Rome, which is at approximately 6:15pm. Your team leader will meet you just outside the baggage claim area and will be displaying a Global Volunteers sign.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: What should I do if my flight is delayed?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: If your flight is delayed or you miss a connection, please notify Global Volunteers at 612-850-4750 as soon as possible of your new arrival plans so that we can inform your team leader. You can call either 800-487-1074 or 651-407-6100 during normal business hours (8 AM to 5 PM Monday through Friday, US central time), or call 612-850-4750 evenings, weekends and holidays. You can leave a voice mail message on any of these numbers if no one answers. However, if it is a weekend or US holiday you must leave the message on 612-850-4750. If you must leave a message, it is important that you also contact the hotel where you are scheduled to stay and leave a message for the Global Volunteers' team leader.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: If I am delayed, what is the absolute latest time I can arrive at the hotel?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Our orientation sessions are a critical component of the preparation for your assignments. If circumstances beyond your control prevent you from reaching the program on the opening day of the program, then we ask that you arrive no later than 9:00 AM on the following day.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: How can I get from the airport to the hotel?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Teams serving Ostuni or surrounding communities will be lodged at the Incanto Hotel in Ostuni proper. The Incanto is about a 30-minute drive from the Brindisi airport, with most of the route being north along the main coastal drive. Curbside taxis from Brindisi to the Incanto Hotel cost about USD60.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Teams serving in Monopoli will be lodged at the Clio Hotel in downtown Monopoli.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: If I am delayed, what is the absolute latest I can arrive at the hotel in Ostuni or Manduria?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: Our orientation sessions are a critical component of the preparation for your teaching assignments. If circumstances beyond your control prevent you from reaching the program on the opening Saturday of the program (the program's first day), then we require that you arrive no later than 9:00 AM on the first Sunday.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
content: What should I do if I arrive prior to the scheduled arrival date?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: If you plan your arrival in Italy before the designated program start date and choose not to meet the team leader at the airport, you will be responsible for your own transportation to the hotel. Curbside taxis from the airport in Brindisi to the hotels in Ostuni and Manduria typically cost USD60 and USD75.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span

content: Will Global Volunteers make a reservation for me at the team hotel if I arrive early?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: If you are arriving early and choose to stay at the Incanto, please contact the hotel directly to make reservations for your early arrival days. If you choose to stay somewhere else, we recommend that you check the numerous guidebooks available on Italy to find a hotel that fits your needs.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span

content: At what time and on what date can I depart Italy?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div p font span
content: for after 6:00 AM on the last day of the service program. Your team leader will accompany you to the airport and will either depart in the morning as well or stay there to assist you with check-in. If you plan your departure for earlier than 6:00 AM on the last day or for the afternoon on that day, you will be responsible for your own transportation. Similarly, if you choose to depart by rail or other means, you will be responsible for your own transportation.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote blockquote div div p font span
content: Volunteers stay at the Incanto, which is an elegant and charming Italian hotel. The rooms are double occupancy, although single rooms are available for an additional fee. Volunteers are placed in double rooms unless the composition of the team requires a single or unless a supplemental fee is paid to Global Volunteers. Please note that energy-saving laws in Puglia prohibit hotels from turning on their heating systems until mid-November, so if you're traveling during the late fall, you may want to bring warm sleeping attire. The Incanto is located two miles from the old town square and the more modern downtown, where a pharmacy, bank, grocery store and other shops are available. Transportation is by taxi or local bus.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote blockquote div div p font span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote blockquote div div p font font span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div blockquote blockquote div div p font span
content: a large tourist-class hotel overlooking the Adriatic. Volunteers are placed in double rooms unless the composition of the team requires a single or unless a supplemental fee is paid to Global Volunteers. All rooms have access to a TV sitting room centrally located for general use. Please keep in mind that energy-saving laws in Puglia prohibit hotels from turning on their heating systems until mid-November, so if you're traveling during the late fall, you may want to bring warm sleeping attire. The hotel is a short five-block walk from the town square and central business district.

content: Single rooms are available for an additional fee. To secure a single room, you must pay Global Volunteers the single supplement charge no later than 30 days prior to the start of the service program.

content: $336 for one week and USD $448 for two weeks.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div p font b span
content: (Hotel prices are subject to change. Please confirm with a volunteer coordinator that these prices are still available)

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: Each room has a private bathroom with shower. As taking baths is more common than showering in this part of Europe, many shower stalls are fitted with only very thin curtains, thus allowing water to get on the bathroom floor. Because most of the bathrooms have faux-marble floor tiles that can get slippery when wet, we recommend that you bring rubber shower slippers for extra safety.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: Neither of the hotels offers complementary laundry service, but there are laundry mats in town and often the hotel can deliver the clothes for you. It costs approximately USD4 - 5 to launder a shirt on your own; if you ask the hotel to assist you, the cost can range as high as USD8. We recommend you ask the price in advance, as prices vary by the garment.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: The current in Italy is 220V. You should bring a converter (to 220V) and an adapter (the large round double-pronged version used throughout Europe) for your electrical appliances unless they are dual voltage.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
content: If I am arriving early, where do I stay?

html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: The food in this part of Italy is wonderful. The breakfast is light -- fruit, cereal, rolls, cheese, yogurt, juice and tea or coffee. Lunch and dinner consists mostly of antipasti, pasta, seafood, various meats (particularly beef, chicken and veal), vegetables, and soups. A typical meal will have bread, a salad or soup, two small main courses, and then dessert or fruit.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: Each of the three hotels has a large dining room where we eat both breakfast and dinner. We have lunch at local restaurants.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: Avoiding meat is not a problem. Strict vegetarians or vegans are more difficult to accommodate, although it is certainly possible. Volunteers with such strict requirements will eat mostly pasta, bread, and vegetables, although egg and butter are used in many such recipes. Consider bringing familiar foods to supplement your diet if you have especially restrictive needs.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font b span
content: Will potable drinking water be provided?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div div p font span
content: The tap water in southern Italy is generally safe, although bottled water is readily available.

content: For volunteers who need their medication refrigerated, such as insulin for diabetics, there is refrigeration available at the hotels. If you do have medication that needs to be refrigerated, please notify the Global Volunteers office ahead of time, so that your team leader can make the appropriate arrangements.

content: Is the water safe to drink?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: Tap water is generally safe to drink, but if you have concerns, consult your team leader for guidance. Bottled water is readily available.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
content: Is it safe to eat food purchased from street vendors?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: We do not recommend eating food sold by street vendors

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: We strongly recommend that you be covered by a medical insurance policy while traveling. Travel agents have information on travel insurance providers.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
content: Does Global Volunteers provide health insurance coverage?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: Global Volunteers does not provide health insurance.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
content: Does Global Volunteers provide medical evacuation insurance?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: Yes, Global Volunteers provides medical evacuation insurance for all volunteers serving outside the U.S.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: An information sheet on AIG will be provided with your orientation materials.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: An information sheet on AIG will be provided with your orientation materials. An orange card with important identification numbers will also be provided. Keep it with you while you are traveling.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b font span
content: Does Global Volunteers provide or recommend travel insurance?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: We strongly recommend that you have a medical insurance policy that covers you while you travel. Travel agents have information on travel insurance providers.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span

html body text table tbody tr td div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: The temperatures in southern Italy range from very warm in the summer months to cold and blustery in the winter. Weather in the early spring and the late fall can be quite variable. For example, in March and November, it is not unknown to have some days approach 65 degrees F while other days the temperature hovers around freezing. If you're traveling between February and early April or between late October and early December, we recommend that you bring clothes for all weather conditions.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font span
content: January and February are the coldest months, with temperatures ranging from the low 50s during the day to the low 30s at night. June through September are the warmest months. The rainy season begins in October or November and typically lasts until March, and during those months you can expect cool and rainy or damp weather. During the rest of the year, temperatures range between 55 and 80 degrees Fahrenheit.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font span
content: Ostuni-based teams stay in a hilly area several hundred feet above sea level. Manduria and Monopoli teams are almost exactly at sea level.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font span
content: The local currency is the euro. As of March 1, 2002, the lira was no longer accepted as legal tender.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font b span
content: What is the current exchange rate?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font span
content: For currency conversion information, refer to the following website:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font a font span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: The airport exchange is often closed because Brindisi is not an international terminal. Therefore, if you are concerned about not having euros before you get to the hotel, we recommend that you change money in Rome or Milan during a layover.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: Most volunteers will have a layover of a few hours in Rome or Milan before boarding a flight to Brindisi. We recommend that you exchange a small amount of money at the airport in Rome or Milan (about USD50 should be enough).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: Beginning on the first Monday of the service program you can exchange money in Ostuni at several different banks. Banks are generally open Monday - Friday from 8:00 AM - 1:00 PM and from 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font font b span
content: Can I use cash, credit cards or checks?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: A debit card can be used to get cash 24 hours a day. There are several outside ATM machines in Ostuni, Monopoli, and Manduria that can be accessed anytime of the day. Additionally, a good exchange rate is available with the debit card, and there is no fee associated with withdrawals. A credit card can also be used for getting cash from an ATM (please contact your credit card company for the four-digit PIN number), though there is a service charge as well as interest on cash advances. Credit cards are not accepted at most stores in Ostuni.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: While traveler's checks are still a safe method of safeguarding cash when traveling, they are not the most convenient. The banks in this area of Italy are not as accustomed to American tourists as are the cities in northern Italy. As a result, the process for changing traveler's checks can be arduous. There can be as much as a 30-minute wait, and most businesses close between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM, making it difficult, though not impossible, to plan trips to the bank within the program schedule.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div blockquote p font font span
content: If you are bringing U.S. cash, bear in mind that torn, worn, or defaced bills are often not accepted. Torn traveler's checks might also not be accepted. US 100-dollar bills are sometimes viewed with suspicion at smaller banks, though at large ones, particularly those in large cities, the $100 bill is the one most commonly exchanged. In the towns where we serve, volunteers have had no problems exchanging $20 and $50 bills.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font font b span
content: How much money should I bring with me?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font span
content: How much you bring depends on your personal spending and shopping habits and whether or not you want to go on an excursion during free time on the weekend. Weekend trips can cost between USD100 - 300, depending on where you go, and the transportation and accommodations used. Your souvenir budget is discretionary. Most shops are open for business during the morning hours and then are closed in the afternoon from 1:00 PM � 3:00 or 5:00 PM. Stores then re-open in the evening around 7:00 PM. Postage for postcards costs about .60 euros.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div div p font font a span

content: Can I make phone calls from my room?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font b span
content: How can my family contact me while I am in Italy?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font span
content: In the event of an emergency, your family should refer to the contact sheet that you will receive prior to your departure for Italy. This will include phone numbers for the hotel where you will be staying, our hosts in Italy, and Global Volunteers business and after hours phones. Be sure to leave a copy with them.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font span
content: There will be phones and faxes locally available for you to use for international communication. However, using locally purchased phone cards is usually cheaper than calling directly through the hotel.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font b span
content: Can I make phone calls from my room?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font span
content: The rooms at the Incanto have a telephone (dial 0 to place calls; dial 9 to reach the front desk). You are responsible for any charges for calls made from your room.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font b span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div p font font span
content: There are one or two Internet cafes in Ostuni, Monopoli, and Manduria, though they are not all within easy walking distance.

content: What is the average air fare?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div p font font span
content: Average roundtrip airfare from the United States is US$800 to USD$900.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div p font font a span
html body text table tbody tr td div div div div p font font b span
content: Are all in-country expenses really included?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td div div div div p font font span
content: The service program fee includes all meals, project-related ground transportation, lodging, project expenses, orientation materials, and team leader services. Airfare to and from Italy and free-time activities are not included.
